title: Tens of thousands of Palestinians reportedly shelter in Gaza City hospital
description: Medical officials said tens of thousands of Palestinians are sheltering in a hospital in Gaza City after Israel told Palestinians to evacuate and head further south in the Gaza Strip. Many are hoping Israel won’t attack the hospital. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports.

title: Northern California sheriff’s deputy found dead in her home, boyfriend arrested
description: A Northern California sheriff's deputy was found dead in her home and her boyfriend has been arrested, authorities said.

title: A week on, hope wears thin for families of those taken hostage by Hamas
description: It has been one week since Hamas militants swept through southern Israel, killing people in the hundreds and taking dozens more hostage in an unprecedented attack that shook the nation and shocked the world — and families with loved ones missing are still desperate for answers.

title: 3 people killed in shooting at party, Denver police say
description: Three people were killed and three others were wounded after gunfire erupted at a party in Denver, authorities said.

title: What is Hezbollah? A look at the Iran-backed militant group on the sidelines of the Israel-Hamas war
description: As Israel’s military prepares for what appears to be an imminent ground invasion of the Gaza Strip, the Hezbollah militant group looms in Lebanon.

title: Series of Israeli rockets strikes on Gaza
description: New rockets are striking on Gaza as the Israeli military is prepping for an air, sea, and land invasion.

title: Olympic gold medalist Mary Lou Retton is improving and responding to pneumonia treatment, daughter says
description: Olympic gold medalist Mary Lou Retton remains in the intensive care unit battling severe pneumonia, but is improving and responding to treatment, her daughter said Saturday, calling her progress "truly remarkable."

title: Big moments from the beginning of the Sam Bankman-Fried trial
description: Two of the people closest to Sam Bankman-Fried were asked the same question as they began their testimony this week: Did they commit financial crimes while working at FTX, the cryptocurrency exchange that crumbled last fall?

title: Australians decide against creating a way for Indigenous people to advise Parliament
description: Bipartisan support for successfully changing the constitution to create an Indigenous Voice to advise Parliament on minority issues never emerged, and Indigenous leaders were divided on the idea.

title: Are Miami Beach's Art Deco buildings in danger from developers?
description: Preservation advocates say the Art Deco buildings that give Miami Beach its character may be vulnerable to demolition under proposals from three state legislators.

title: Early results in New Zealand election indicate Christopher Luxon poised to become prime minister
description: Early results indicate people were favoring a conservative change after six years of a liberal government led for most of that time by Jacinda Ardern.

title: Love empanadas? More Latino comfort foods enter the American dining scene
description: More Latino and Latin American foods are becoming more common in American cuisine, like empanadas, arepas, tamales, pasteles and coffee drinks like café con leche.

title: How Arabs living in Israel’s Negev desert are sitting ducks for Hamas
description: Hamas’ surprise assault killed more than 1,300 people in Israel. The vast majority were Israeli Jews, but the dead also included 15 Bedouin Arabs.

title: Judge punishes Rudy Giuliani for 'continued and flagrant disregard' of court orders
description: A federal judge said jurors at an upcoming defamation damages trial will be told that the former Trump lawyer intentionally tried to hide financial documents.

title: Inside Gaza's overrun hospitals, scenes of chaos and horror
description: Hospitals in Gaza are overrun with injured patients — many of whom are children. Nearly a week after Hamas' attacks, Israel ordered the evacuation of northern Gaza.

title: Democrats refuse to help GOP out of speaker mess, trashing Jim Jordan as an 'insurrectionist'
description: Democratic leaders spoke on the Capitol steps and dialed up their rhetoric against Republicans for nominating a conservative firebrand to be House speaker.

title: Nightly News Full Broadcast (October 13th)
description: Lester Holt anchors from inside Israel amid our continuing coverage of the Israel-Hamas war. We have more details on Israel giving Palestinians 24 hours to head south, U.S. officials helping with efforts to free hostages from Hamas and more.

title: Michael Cohen health issue delays court showdown with Donald Trump
description: Cohen had been expected to testify next week in a civil fraud case against Trump, who was planning to attend to hear testimony from his former attorney.

title: Suspect in Natalee Holloway disappearance to appear for plea and sentencing hearing in fraud scheme
description: Joran van der Sloot, the Dutch man suspected in the 2005 disappearance of Natalee Holloway, will appear Wednesday for a plea and sentencing hearing in a case alleging that he aimed to extort hundreds of thousands of dollars from the woman's family, according to court records filed Friday.

title: GOP lawmaker plans to launch a bid for House speaker if Jim Jordan falls short
description: Rep. Mike Johnson of Louisiana is laying the groundwork to seek the speaker's gavel if Rep. Jim Jordan is unable to get the votes needed on the House floor.
